Key Arguments: News media organizations should be excluded from the draft Bill as they are already regulated by existing laws, regulations, self-regulation, and editorial standards.
The current drafting imposes an unnecessary and heavy burden on news media organizations by capturing all content they publish, even if they did not produce it.
News media organizations are already responsible for all content they publish, including third-party comments, and should not be further burdened by the proposed legislation.
Main Themes: Exclusion of news media from the legislation
Existing regulatory frameworks for news media
Notable Quotes: The current drafting catches news media organizations for all content they publish if they did not produce it, and as a result imposes an unnecessary and heavy burden on organizations that are already responsible for all that they publish.
